official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide
		  authority for certain members of the Armed Forces to transfer entitlement to
		  Post-9/11 Educational Assistance to their dependents.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Education Assistance to Realign New
			 Eligibilities for Dependents (EARNED) Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Authority of
			 certain members of the Armed Forces who have served 20 years on active duty to
			 transfer entitlement to Post-9/11 Educational Assistance to their
			 dependents

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 3319(b) of
			 title 38, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 by striking the period and inserting

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following new paragraph:

any period of service in the Armed Forces,
				as of any date between September 11, 2001, and September 30, 2011, including at
				least 90 days of such service after September 10,
				2001.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and who completed any period
			 of service in the Armed Forces and was discharged or released from such service
			 under honorable conditions before September 30, 2011, may transfer all or part
			 of the individual’s entitlement to an eligible dependent under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 3319 of
			 title 38, United States Code

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 during the period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act and ending
			 on December 31, 2015, an individual who is entitled to educational assistance
			 under

The amendments made by this Act shall take effect as if
			 included in the enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act
			 of 2008
